thig3.5:1.1: "Oh mother, you cry in the forest for Jīvā, gone beyond life.
thig3.5:1.5: were burnt in that cremation ground:
thig3.5:1.6: you sorrowed over all of them in the same way."
thig3.5:2.1: "At last, you pulled out my dart,
thig3.5:2.2: difficult to see, stuck to the heart.
thig3.5:2.4: but now the grief caused by the loss of a daughter has been dispelled.
thig3.5:3.1: Today the dart has been pulled out,
thig3.5:3.2: I am free of craving, fully quenched.
thig3.5:3.3: I go to the sage for refuge -
thig3.5:3.4: to the Buddha, Dhamma, and Sangha."
